segment.tokens: Buster looked up at Happy Jack Squirrel
Buster winked
Then he walked over to the tree in which Happy Jack was sitting
to the tree in which Happy Jack was sitting
he stood up
he suddenly began to scramble up the tree
There was nothing slow about the way Buster Bear went up that tree
the way Buster Bear went up tree
Happy Jack squealed with sudden fright
Happy Jack started for the top of that tree
as only Happy Jack can climb
Then he made a flying jump to the next tree
Halfway up Buster
stopped
Then he began
he to come down
He came down
tail first
When he was within ten feet of the ground
he simply let
go
he dropped
“ I did
how I get of a tree
out
just to show you when I am really in a hurry
that ” explained Buster
I do n't climb trees much now
unless it is for honey
when I was a little
I used to love to climb trees
Suddenly Buster sat up very straight
Buster pointed his nose up in the wind
An anxious look crept into his face
He cocked his ears as if listening with all his might
That is
just what he was doing
Presently he dropped down to all fours
“ Excuse me ” said
he “
I think
I had better be going
Farmer Brown is coming down the Lone Little Path . ”
Buster turned at a speed that was simply astonishing in such a clumsy-looking fellow
Buster disappeared
a speed was simply in such a clumsy-looking fellow
“ Buster eyes are not very
” said she “
there is nothing the matter with his nose with his ears
If Buster says
that Farmer Brown is coming down the Lone Little Path
there is no doubt
that he is
although he may be some distance away yet
Buster has been enough to learn
that he has every reason to fear man
he promptly takes himself of the way at the first hint that man is near
out
that man is
It is a funny
most men are as of Buster
as Buster is of them
they have n't the least need
Where man is concerned
there is n't one of you little people more timid than Buster Bear
The faintest smell of man will make
him run
If he should be wounded
he cornered
he would fight
Mrs. Bear would fight to protect her babies
these are the only
a Black Bear will face a man
You think
Buster is
he is
Buster has relatives very much bigger than he
He has one
whom he would look actually small
I 'll tell you a little about these cousins of Buster . ”
CHAPTER XXXIII Buster Bear Big Cousins Buster Bear had been about the coming of Farmer Brown
It was only a few after Buster 's disappearance
that Farmer Brown footsteps were heard
coming down the Lone Little Path of course
that ended school for that morning
But the next morning all were on hand again at sun-up
for every one wanted to hear about Buster Bear 's big cousins
where Whistler the Marmot Little Chief the Pika live
“ Way out in the mountains of the Far West , where Whistler the Marmot and Little Chief the Pika live , is a big of Buster Bear
” began Old Mother Nature
“ He is Silvertip the Grizzly Bear
in the past no animal in all this great country was so feared man as he
times have changed
Silvertip has been so hunted with terrible guns that he has learned to fear man quite as much as Buster does
that he has learned to fear man quite as much
as Buster does
“ He is than Buster
“ He possessed of tremendous strength
Instead of a black coat he has a coat
a coat varies from yellowish-brown to almost black
The tips of the hairs usually are
giving him a frosted appearance
this is
what has given him his name
His claws are longer more than those of Buster
in fact those claws are so
that they look very terrible
Because they are so
Silvertip can not climb trees
if they prevent him climbing trees
But they are the finest of tools for digging out Marmots and ground Squirrels
Even when Whistler the Marmot makes his home down in among the rocks
he is not
Silvertip strength is so
that he can pull over
he roll aside great rocks
“ He is a great
“ covers a wide range of country in his search for food
Sometimes he visits the Cattle ranges
he kills Cattle
So great is his strength
that he can kill a Cow with ease
Clumsy looking as he is
he is a very fast
only a fast Horse can outrun him
Like Buster he lives on anything he can find that is eatable
he can find
anything is
He has been so hunted man
that he has become very cunning
where he lives
in all the great mountains where he lives there is no one with quicker wits
At certain seasons of the year great numbers of a fish called
Salmon come up the rivers in that country
then Silvertip lives high
He watches beside a pool
until a Salmon swims within reach
then with a swift movement of one paw he scoops the fish
on to the bank
he finds a place
where the water is so
a place the fish have difficulty getting across
there he seizes them
as they struggle up the river
In winter he sleeps
just as Buster does usually in a well-hidden cave
